node.html:
Research üî≠

I am a Research Fellow at MSR India. I am studying how methods like fuzzing, dynamic instrumentation, distributed tracing, and better concurrency tests can be used to find buggy code in large-scale distributed systems.

Broad interests: Distributed Systems and Software Engineering.
Topics I want to explore: Serverless Systems, Microservice Reliability, Smart Contracts Security

CV.

    IEEE International Conference on Software Maintenance and Evolution (ICSME 2021)

  2. Distributed Robot Exploration in Simulated Environments pdf
    International Workshop on Soft Computing Applications, Romania (SOFA 2020)
    Aniruddha Mysore and Sudarshan TSB.
    Awarded Best Student Paper üèÜ

  4. Segmentation of key structures of the eye with two-step classifier pdf
    Journal of Intelligent & Fuzzy Systems (2021)
    Adish Rao, Aniruddha Mysore, Siddhanth Ajri, Abhishek Guragol, Poulami Sarkar, and Gowri Srinivasa.

About üë®üèΩ‚Äçüíª

I am a systems researcher. I was an engineer at Morgan Stanley, where I worked with platform infrastructure for low-latency/algo trading.

I am fascinated by the elegant technical engineering behind great software products. I was a co-founder of Turtlewig.com, where I led the development team.

I frequently contribute to Open Source projects. I was a Google Summer of Code 2019 (GSOC) student with Red Hen Labs.
A series of semi-successful projects on using drones for immediate communication and response during disasters, with Poulami Sarkar.
Worked with some wonderful people like Harshika Jain to develop the Hyperloop India Pod telemetry software.
Reinforcement Learning agent that plays on the Pokemon Showdown simulator. Developed with Kushal Naidu as part of my AI coursework.
